Index.title: Versatile Programming: Bridging Psychology  with Code
Index.description: Hi! I'm Tomas, a passionate programmer with a background in psychology. My journey from psychology to programming brings unique perspectives and creative solutions. Explore how I can add value to your team in my portfolio.

biography.title: [Bio]
biography.description: Before diving into the world of coding, I was a psychologist, navigating through hospitals and working directly with patients. Surprisingly, those early days laid the foundation for much of my current career. They gifted me with a unique perspective and a set of soft skills that are invaluable in the fast-paced world of programming. Communication is king, whether it's collaborating with colleagues or tech leads, mastering the art of giving and receiving feedback is essential. Driven by curiosity, a trait that's always been a part of me, I embarked on a self-taught journey into programming during the Covid era. It was like discovering a new universe within my own, and I decided to make a complete 180-degree turn. Armed with my projects, I set out to find a job, landing my first gigs where I learned on the fly. Remote work in the programming realm gave me the freedom to pursue another passion: traveling. I found myself relocating to Australia, working for a homegrown Aussie company. After indulging in a 5-month adventure across Asia, followed by a blissful reunion with family in Buenos Aires for 2 months, I decided to settle in Europe, Spain, to dive back into the world of tech.
biography.footer: 'Life begins at the end of your comfort zone.' - Neale Donald Walsch

experience.title: Web developer
experience.description: Worked on several fixes for the Session desktop app, which uses Electron JS. In charge of weekly deployments with VPS and fixes/features on several OXEN/SESSION/OPTF websites. working with Next JS. Entire migration of OPTF website from Wordpress to Next js. Developing a project which connects criptocurrency contracts in Solidity with a Next js Website.

experience.title: Fullstack developer
experience.description: Project 1: Website with interactive menu, using React JS, Tailwind and Firebase. - Project 2: Website tech migration in each section, using React JS and Tailwind. Project 3: Website focused on professional coaches workbooks, using Vue Js and Express in backend together with MySql. Project 4: Ecommerce website for professional coaches profiles, using React js, Gatbsy and Tailwind in front and Express js, firebase for auth and mySql with postgreSql. Project 5: Coaching app based on tinder platform connecting clients with coaches, using React Native with Typescript with Redux for state handling and different implementations along the way such as WebRTC for videocalls, and Express JS with postgresSQL for the backend .

experience.title: Frontend developer
experience.description: In charge of the entire UALA's static websites for Argentina, Colombia and Mexico, using Next Js and Tailwind with Vercel.

experience.title: Frontend developer
experience.description: Developing website with VTEX IO that contains native components as much as customised ones according to the clients needs. As the most experienced frontend dev in the team, I am in charge of daily deployment, which gives me major responsabilites and everyday learnings.

experience.title: Fullstack developer
experience.description: Fullstack Acceleration internship developing websites in teams with SCRUM methodology for non profit organizations. using React JS and Express JS.

portfolio.title: Cryptotracker
portfolio.description: First app made entirely with React Native, which allows you to see all the cryptocoins available and it's markets values, also being able to select one to see more details and pick your favorites.

portfolio.title: Budgapp
portfolio.description: My second fullstack project used MySql for a website where users can manage incomes and expenses by categories, filter, create, or modify operations. Built with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, React-Bootstrap, Modal React, Styled-components, Axios, Node.js, Express, MySql, JWT, Express-validator.

portfolio.title: Epayco
portfolio.description: My first fullstack project used MongoDB as the database. It allows users to create accounts, manage money, and buy services with email verification. Built with React, Bootstrap, Axios, Node.js, MongoDB, NodeMailer, and Express.js.

portfolio.title: Pokedex
portfolio.description: With the PokeApi implementation, I generated a website with the Pokemon Saga history and a final Pokemon list, using vanilla javascript and Bootstrap

portfolio.title: Di Lorenzo
portfolio.description: I made a website for Di Lorenzo Restaurant implementing AJAX with Fetch using an external API from Stripe, that works as backend to give me the food and payment data

portfolio.title: Chuck Norris Robots
portfolio.description: With the help of two external apis and react, I generated a button that delivers a joke about the famous Chuck Norris told by a Robot. I used an Api for the robot images and another one for the jokes, using React js.
